metadata.case_name: Appellant (assessee firm) v. Respondents (sales tax authorities)

facts.text: Appellant is a firm registered under the Mysore Sales Tax Act.
Appellant assessed to sales tax on turnover of over Rs. 58,36,422.26 Nps for two quarters from April 1, 1957 to September 30, 1957.
Tax imposed at 0.02 Nps per rupee amounting to Rs. 1,16,728.44 Nps.
Under Mysore Sales Tax Act, rate was 3 pies per rupee, which would yield Rs. 91,690/- tax.
Difference of Rs. 25,038/- due to conversion after amendment of Indian Coinage Act by Act 31 of 1955.
Mysore High Court dismissed writ petition under Art. 226 on July 15, 1960, refusing to quash assessment order.
Indian Coinage Act amended; s.14 divides rupee into 100 naya paisa; old annas/pice/pies converted to nearest naya paisa.

Mysore Existing Laws (Construction of References to Values) Act, 1957 (Act 12 of 1957) enacted on March 1, 1957, for construing references in existing laws to annas/pice/pies as naya paisa per Coinage Act s.14.
Previous writ petition under Art. 226 set aside provisional assessment on June 7, 1958, based on memo by Advocate General not opposing.

legal_issues.text: Whether substitution of 0.02 Nps for 3 pies amounts to enhancement of tax illegally, breaching Art. 265 of Constitution.
Whether change in tax rate requires procedure for Money Bills under Arts. 198, 199, 207 of Constitution.
Whether Indian Coinage Act (Central Act) can change rate of tax under state Mysore Sales Tax Act.
Whether principle of res judicata applies from previous writ setting aside provisional assessment.

petitioner_arguments.text: Substitution of 2 naya paisa for 3 pies changes tax leviable under Mysore Sales Tax Act, amounting to enhancement without Money Bill procedure under Arts. 198, 199, 207.
Indian Coinage Act, being Central Act under item 36 List I, cannot change state tax rate.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Indian Coinage Act; List I item 36

petitioner_arguments.text: Res judicata applies from previous High Court order setting aside provisional assessment.

respondent_arguments.text: Memo stating no opposition to setting aside provisional assessment in previous writ.

court_reasoning.text: Substitution of naya paisa for pies/annas/pice is mere change of currency of equivalent value, not enhancement of tax.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No enhancement enacted; merely substitution of one currency by another of equivalent value.

court_reasoning.text: Even assuming taxing measure, validity not challengeable for procedural irregularity under Arts. 212 and 255; Art. 212 protects legislative proceedings from question on procedure.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Arts. 212 and 255 regard recommendation/sanction as procedure only; no invalidity if assent given.

court_reasoning.text: Mysore Act 12 of 1957 provides for conversion in state laws; not unconstitutional or new taxing measure.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Deals merely with conversion of old currency to new.

court_reasoning.text: Previous writ set aside provisional assessment on consent memo; no issues decided, no res judicata.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No indication that present question was raised or decided.

holdings.text: Substitution under Coinage Act and Mysore Act 12/1957 is valid conversion of currency, not tax enhancement.
Tax levy not invalid for alleged Money Bill procedure irregularity.
Mysore Act 12/1957 validly provides for currency conversion in state laws.
No res judicata from previous provisional assessment order.

statutes_cited.name: Mysore Sales Tax Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Rate of tax originally 3 pies per rupee; assessment under it after currency conversion

statutes_cited.name: Indian Coinage Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Provides for division of rupee into 100 naya paisa and conversion of old currency references

statutes_cited.name: Mysore Existing Laws (Construction of References to Values) Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Construes references in existing state laws to annas/pice/pies as naya paisa per Coinage Act s.14

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Writ jurisdiction; tax without authority void; Money Bill procedure; protection from procedural challenge in legislature

outcome.summary: Appeal by special leave dismissed; High Court order upheld; tax assessment in naya paisa upheld as valid currency conversion, not illegal enhancement.

key_quotes.text: "by substitution of new currency i.e. naya paisa in place of annas, pice and pies no enhancement of tax was enacted but it was merely a substitution of one currency by another of equivalent value."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding rejecting tax enhancement claim

key_quotes.text: "All references in any enactment... to any value expressed in annas, pice and pies shall be construed as references to that value expressed in new paisa..."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Quotes Coinage Act s.14(3) on mandatory construction of old currency references
